query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Vago già di cercar dentro e dintorno 2 la divina foresta spessa e viva, 3 ch’a li occhi temperava il novo giorno,
4 sanza più aspettar, lasciai la riva, 5 prendendo la campagna lento lento 6 su per lo suol che d’ogne parte auliva.
query.result:
1 I already wander to search within and around 2 the divine forest, thick and alive, 3 that tempered the new day to my eyes,
4 without waiting any longer, I left the shore, 5 taking the countryside slowly, slowly 6 up over the ground that was fragrant on every side.

22 My slow steps had already carried me 23 so far into the ancient forest that I 24 could not see again where I had entered;
25 and behold, a stream prevented me from going any further, 26 which turned to the left with its tiny waves 27 the grass that grew on its bank.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Tutte l’acque che son di qua più monde, 29 parrieno avere in sé mistura alcuna 30 verso di quella, che nulla nasconde,
31 avvegna che si mova bruna bruna 32 sotto l’ombra perpetüa, che mai 33 raggiar non lascia sole ivi né luna.
query.result:
28 All the waters that are purer than this one 29 would seem to have some impurity in them 30 compared to this one, which hides nothing,
31 although it flows dark brown 32 under the perpetual shade, which never 33 lets the sun or the moon shine there.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Coi piè ristetti e con li occhi passai 35 di là dal fiumicello, per mirare 36 la gran varïazion d’i freschi mai;
37 e là m’apparve, sì com’ elli appare 38 subitamente cosa che disvia 39 per maraviglia tutto altro pensare,
40 una donna soletta che si gia 41 e cantando e scegliendo fior da fiore 42 ond’ era pinta tutta la sua via.

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 «Deh, bella donna, che a’ raggi d’amore 44 ti scaldi, s’i’ vo’ credere a’ sembianti 45 che soglion esser testimon del core,
46 vegnati in voglia di trarreti avanti», 47 diss’ io a lei, «verso questa rivera, 48 tanto ch’io possa intender che tu canti.
query.result:
43 "Ah, beautiful lady, who warm yourself in the rays of love, 44 if I am to believe the outward signs 45 that are usually evidence of the heart,
46 may you feel like coming forward," 47 I said to her, "toward this bank, 48 so that I can understand what you are singing.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Tu mi fai rimembrar dove e qual era 50 Proserpina nel tempo che perdette 51 la madre lei, ed ella primavera».
query.result: 49 You make me remember where and what 50 Proserpina was like at the time when she lost 51 her mother, and she, the springtime.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 Come si volge, con le piante strette 53 a terra e intra sé, donna che balli, 54 e piede innanzi piede a pena mette,
55 volsesi in su i vermigli e in su i gialli 56 fioretti verso me, non altrimenti 57 che vergine che li occhi onesti avvalli;
58 e fece i prieghi miei esser contenti, 59 sì appressando sé, che ’l dolce suono 60 veniva a me co’ suoi intendimenti.

Please translate each line literally into English.
61 Tosto che fu là dove l’erbe sono 62 bagnate già da l’onde del bel fiume, 63 di levar li occhi suoi mi fece dono.
query.result: 61 As soon as she was where the grasses are 62 already moistened by the waves of the beautiful river, 63 she granted me the gift of raising her eyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Non credo che splendesse tanto lume 65 sotto le ciglia a Venere, trafitta 66 dal figlio fuor di tutto suo costume.
query.result: 64 I do not believe that so much light shone 65 under the eyelashes of Venus, pierced 66 by her son, acting completely out of character.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Ella ridea da l’altra riva dritta, 68 trattando più color con le sue mani, 69 che l’alta terra sanza seme gitta.
query.result: 67 She was laughing on the opposite bank, 68 handling more colors with her hands 69 than the bountiful earth produces without seed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Tre passi ci facea il fiume lontani; 71 ma Elesponto, là ’ve passò Serse, 72 ancora freno a tutti orgogli umani,
73 più odio da Leandro non sofferse 74 per mareggiare intra Sesto e Abido, 75 che quel da me perch’ allor non s’aperse.
query.result:
70 The river kept us three paces apart; 71 but the Hellespont, where Xerxes crossed, 72 still a check to all human arrogance,
73 did not suffer more hatred from Leander 74 for churning between Sestos and Abydos, 75 than that river suffered from me because it did not open up then.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 «Voi siete nuovi, e forse perch’ io rido», 77 cominciò ella, «in questo luogo eletto 78 a l’umana natura per suo nido,
79 maravigliando tienvi alcun sospetto; 80 ma luce rende il salmo Delectasti, 81 che puote disnebbiar vostro intelletto.
query.result:
76 "You are newcomers, and perhaps because I am laughing," 77 she began, "in this place chosen 78 for human nature as its nest,
79 some suspicion keeps you wondering; 80 but the psalm Delectasti sheds light, 81 which can clear your understanding.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 E tu che se’ dinanzi e mi pregasti, 83 dì s’altro vuoli udir; ch’i’ venni presta 84 ad ogne tua question tanto che basti».
query.result: 82 "And you who are in front and asked me, 83 say if you want to hear anything else; for I came quickly 84 to answer all your questions, as long as it is enough."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
85 «L’acqua», diss’ io, «e ’l suon de la foresta 86 impugnan dentro a me novella fede 87 di cosa ch’io udi’ contraria a questa».
query.result: 85 "The water," I said, "and the sound of the forest 86 are stirring up within me a new belief 87 about something I heard that contradicts this."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Ond’ ella: «Io dicerò come procede 89 per sua cagion ciò ch’ammirar ti face, 90 e purgherò la nebbia che ti fiede.
query.result: 88 Then she said: "I will explain how 89 what makes you wonder proceeds from its cause, 90 and I will clear away the fog that is clouding your mind.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Lo sommo Ben, che solo esso a sé piace, 92 fé l’uom buono e a bene, e questo loco 93 diede per arr’ a lui d’etterna pace.
query.result: 91 The supreme Good, who alone delights in himself, 92 made man good and for good, and gave this place 93 to him as a pledge of eternal peace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Per sua difalta qui dimorò poco; 95 per sua difalta in pianto e in affanno 96 cambiò onesto riso e dolce gioco.

Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Perché ’l turbar che sotto da sé fanno 98 l’essalazion de l’acqua e de la terra, 99 che quanto posson dietro al calor vanno,
100 a l’uomo non facesse alcuna guerra, 101 questo monte salìo verso ’l ciel tanto, 102 e libero n’è d’indi ove si serra.
query.result:
97 So that the disturbances that the exhalations from the water and the earth, 98 which follow the heat as much as they can, make below it,
99 would not make war on man, 100 this mountain rose so high toward heaven, 102 and is free from them where it is enclosed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Non parrebbe di là poi maraviglia, 116 udito questo, quando alcuna pianta 117 sanza seme palese vi s’appiglia.
query.result: 115 It would not seem like a marvel then, 116 after hearing this, when some plant 117 takes root there without any visible seed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 E saper dei che la campagna santa 119 dove tu se’, d’ogne semenza è piena, 120 e frutto ha in sé che di là non si schianta.
query.result: 118 And you should know that the holy plain 119 where you are is full of every seed, 120 and it has fruit in it that is not uprooted there.

121 The water that you see does not rise from a spring 122 that replenishes vapor that frost converts, 123 like a river that gains and loses strength;
124 but it flows from a constant and reliable source, 125 which takes back from the will of God 126 as much as it pours forth from its two openings.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Da questa parte con virtù discende 128 che toglie altrui memoria del peccato; 129 da l’altra d’ogne ben fatto la rende.

Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Quinci Letè; così da l’altro lato 131 Eünoè si chiama, e non adopra 132 se quinci e quindi pria non è gustato:
133 a tutti altri sapori esto è di sopra.
query.result:
130 On this side Lethe; thus on the other side 131 it is called Eunoe, and it does not work 132 unless it is tasted first on this side and then on that:
133 it is superior to all other flavors.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
134 E avvegna ch’assai possa esser sazia 135 la sete tua perch’ io più non ti scuopra,
136 darotti un corollario ancor per grazia; 137 né credo che ’l mio dir ti sia men caro, 138 se oltre promession teco si spazia.
query.result:
134 And although your thirst may be largely satisfied 135 because I do not reveal more to you,
136 I will give you one more corollary as a favor; 137 and I do not think that my words will be less dear to you, 138 if I go beyond my promise in speaking with you.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Quelli ch’anticamente poetaro 140 l’età de l’oro e suo stato felice, 141 forse in Parnaso esto loco sognaro.
query.result: 139 Those who in ancient times sang of 140 the golden age and its happy state, 141 perhaps dreamed of this place on Parnassus.

145 I turned back then, completely 146 to my poets, and I saw that they had heard 147 the last statement with laughter;
148 then I turned my face back to the beautiful lady.
